sentence: * For SE data, the adapters are evaluated by analyzing the tails of first ~1M reads

sentence: This evaluation may be inacurrate, and you can specify the adapter sequence by `-a` or `--adapter_sequence` option

sentence: If adapter sequence is specified, the auto detection for SE data will be disabled
author: OpenGene

sentence: * For PE data, the adapters can be detected by per-read overlap analysis, which seeks for the overlap of each pair of reads

sentence: This method is robust and fast, so normally you don't have to input the adapter sequence even you know it

sentence: This tool is developed in C++ with multithreading supported to afford high performance
author: OpenGene

sentence: If `--cut_right` is enabled together with `--cut_front`, `--cut_front` will be performed first before `--cut_right` to avoid dropping whole reads due to the low quality starting bases
author: OpenGene

sentence: `fastp` perform `overlap analysis` for PE data, which try to find an overlap of each pair of reads
author: OpenGene

sentence: When `polyG tail trimming` and `polyX tail trimming` are both enabled, fastp will perform `polyG trimming` first, then perform `polyX trimming`
author: OpenGene

sentence: For best performance, it is suggested to specify the file number to be a multiple of the thread number
author: OpenGene

sentence: Adapter sequences can be automatically detected, which means you don't have to input the adapter sequences to trim them
author: OpenGene

sentence: Adapter sequences can be automatically detected for both PE/SE data
author: OpenGene

sentence: If adapter sequence is specified, the auto detection for SE data will be disabled
author: OpenGene

sentence: * For PE data, the adapters can be detected by per-read overlap analysis, which seeks for the overlap of each pair of reads
author: OpenGene

sentence: * For PE data, the adapter sequence auto-detection is disabled by default since the adapters can be trimmed by overlap analysis
author: OpenGene

sentence: * For PE data, `fastp` will run a little slower if you specify the sequence adapters or enable adapter auto-detection, but usually result in a slightly cleaner output, since the overlap analysis may fail due to sequencing errors or adapter dimers
author: OpenGene

sentence: If your data is from the TruSeq library, you can add `--adapter_sequence=AGATCGGAAGAGCACACGTCTGAACTCCAGTCA --adapter_sequence_r2=AGATCGGAAGAGCGTCGTGTAGGGAAAGAGTGT` to your command lines, or enable auto detection for PE data by specifing `detect_adapter_for_pe`
author: OpenGene

sentence: * `fastp` contains some built-in known adapter sequences for better auto-detection
author: OpenGene

sentence: `fastp` first trims the auto-detected adapter or the adapter sequences given by `--adapter_sequence | --adapter_sequence_r2`, then trims the adapters given by `--adapter_fasta` one by one
author: OpenGene

sentence: If `--cut_right` is enabled together with `--cut_front`, `--cut_front` will be performed first before `--cut_right` to avoid dropping whole reads due to the low quality starting bases
author: OpenGene

sentence: This function is based on overlapping detection, which has adjustable parameters `overlap_len_require (default 30)`, `overlap_diff_limit (default 5)` and `overlap_diff_percent_limit (default 20%)`
author: OpenGene

sentence: `fastp` can detect the polyG in read tails and trim them
author: OpenGene

sentence: NextSeq/NovaSeq data is detected by the machine ID in the FASTQ records
author: OpenGene

sentence: A minimum length can be set with `<poly_g_min_len>` for `fastp` to detect polyG
author: OpenGene

sentence: A minimum length can be set with `<poly_x_min_len>` for `fastp` to detect polyX
author: OpenGene

sentence: A figure is provided for each detected overrepresented sequence, from which you can know where this sequence is mostly found
author: OpenGene

sentence: Same as the [base correction feature](#base-correction-for-pe-data), this function is also based on overlapping detection, which has adjustable parameters `overlap_len_require (default 30)`, `overlap_diff_limit (default 5)` and `overlap_diff_percent_limit (default 20%)`
author: OpenGene

sentence: For SE data, if not specified, the adapter will be auto-detected
author: OpenGene

sentence: --detect_adapter_for_pe          by default, the adapter sequence auto-detection is enabled for SE data only, turn on this option to enable it for PE data
author: OpenGene

sentence: --poly_g_min_len                 the minimum length to detect polyG in the read tail
author: OpenGene

sentence: --poly_x_min_len                 the minimum length to detect polyX in the read tail
author: OpenGene

sentence: --overlap_len_require            the minimum length to detect overlapped region of PE reads
author: OpenGene

sentence: --overlap_diff_limit             the maximum number of mismatched bases to detect overlapped region of PE reads
author: OpenGene

sentence: --overlap_diff_percent_limit     the maximum percentage of mismatched bases to detect overlapped region of PE reads
author: OpenGene
